articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: European Leaders Rally to Support Ukraine
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron discussed European defense and support for Ukraine with U.S. President Donald Trump, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, and European leaders. His talks aim to advance the European Commission's proposals on defense investment and Ukrainian aid. Further discussions are anticipated in the following days.
articles.content: In a series of diplomatic talks, French President Emmanuel Macron engaged with U.S. President Donald Trump and Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, focusing on fortifying Ukraine with European support. Prior consultations with European leaders ha... [518 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Turbulence Within: Trump's Administration Faces Legal Hurdles and Resignations
articles.description: The Trump administration tackles legal challenges at the U.S. Supreme Court over agency leadership and faces internal turmoil with multiple resignations. It also confronts international criticism, issues warnings to universities about funding cuts, and prepares for changes as Elon Musk's DOGE team stirs debate over government IT systems.
articles.content:
The Trump administration is actively seeking a legal resolution from the U.S. Supreme Court regarding the dismissal of the head of a whistleblower protection agency, marking its first major legal case since Trump assumed office.
The administration al... [631 chars]

articles.author: New York Daily News
articles.title: NYC Mayor Adams calls demands to resign over Trump DOJ indictment dismissal a 'modern day Mein Kampf,' sparking outrage
articles.description: Adams delivered the heated remark while speaking at an event at Brooklyn's Rehoboth Cathedral — a gathering billed as a rally for his reelection in June's Democratic mayoral primary.
articles.content:
Mayor Adams contended Monday that renewed calls for his resignation over President Trump’s Justice Department bid to drop his corruption indictment amounts to “a modern day ‘Mein Kampf,'” a comment that his critics quickly blasted as offensive.
Adams... [2933 chars]

articles.title: Europe needs to toughen up and shrug off Trump’s bullying
articles.description: European leaders need to reduce their dangerous dependence on a new adversarial America.
articles.content: When J.D. Vance took the stage at the Munich Security Conference last week, he issued a stern warning. The US vice president told the assembled politicians and diplomats that free speech and democracy are under attack from European elites: “The threa... [334 chars]

articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Sir Keir Starmer joins Europe in confronting reality of Trump and Putin's emerging new world order
articles.description: European leaders tried to reassert themselves in Paris after being pushed to the sidelines but there is a growing sense that the US and Russia see the world in the same way and may strike deals on more than the future of Ukraine.
articles.content:
Sir Keir Starmer was the first leader to arrive at this meeting in Paris, strolling down the road from the British Embassy.
When he emerged, after three hours of discussion, he looked sombre.
Sir Keir, like the other political heavyweights who came t... [2194 chars]

articles.title: Peter V’landys invites Donald Trump to NRL Las Vegas opener on US TV
articles.description: V’landys showed up on one of the president’s preferred shows to plead with the ‘walking billboard’.
articles.content:
Rugby league supremo Peter V’landys has taken over one of Donald Trump’s preferred TV shows to invite the US president to the NRL’s Las Vegas double-header.

articles.title: Crowds protest outside State House on Presidents Day
articles.description: Large crowds gathered at the State House on Presidents Day to rally against the Trump administration and Elon Musk’s moves to reshape the government.
articles.content:
COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) - Large crowds gathered at the State House on Presidents Day to rally against the Trump administration and Elon Musk’s moves to reshape the government.

articles.title: Can the Fed Look Past Trump’s Tariffs?
articles.description: Top officials are grappling with how to handle potential price increases caused by the administration’s policies.
